Dear Mrs. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Emergency restraint
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160
Section (1) The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for a
Description youth will be limited to:
(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others from
an unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that places the
youth or others at serious threat of violence or injury if no
immediate intervention occurs.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth were placed in unwarranted restraints.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was Consultant 1 and Consultant 2 as during
weekly restraint reviews of incident reports concerns of
unwarranted restraints were found.
Restraint with Youth A on 3/5/2024
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Youth A and Youth C left school and went to Career
Tech Center (CTC). Youth A reported he saw Staff 1 coming and
told Youth C to run. Youth A ran and Staff 1 began running
toward him. Youth A attempted to turn to go the opposite direction
however Staff 1 ran into him as Staff 1 was running so fast and
couldn’t slow down to avoid running into him. Youth A and Staff 1
fell to the ground. Youth A went to get up and Staff 1 restrained
him. Youth A reported he was restrained because he was
running. Youth A described being restrained while he was getting
up off the ground as he was standing however his knees were still
bent and he was not standing all the way up yet. Youth A
demonstrated being restrained in a benevolent restraint as his
arms were in the benevolent restraint position. Youth A reported
“the restraint was proper.” Staff 1 did not say anything to Youth A
2

during the restraint. Youth A reported he did not try to hit staff or
resist the restraint. Youth A did not know any other staff or youth
who would have witnessed the restraint. Staff 1 restrained Youth
A and walked him back to the house. Youth A reported
approximately halfway back to the house, Staff 2 transitioned into
the restraint with Staff 1 to a two-person restraint. Youth A
reported he was released from the restraint by the trail at
Holbrook. Youth A reported this was the first time he has ran from
the facility and “went out of bounds”.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Staff 1 reported he recalled the restraint with Youth A.
Staff 1 heard over the radio Youth A and Youth C were headed to
CTC. Staff 1 and Staff 2 started heading down to CTC. Staff 1
and Staff 2 did not see Youth A. Staff 1 was informed by a staff,
unable to recall what staff, walking by that she saw Youth A
running. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were about halfway to CTC when they
heard commotion coming from CTC. Staff 1 saw Youth A and
approximately four to five other youth running through the woods
toward Ashmun house. Youth A was running in the woods with
Youth D. Staff 1 reported there was approximately fifty yards
between him and Youth A. Staff 1 advised Staff 2 to focus on
getting Youth C and allow the female staff to get the female youth.
Staff 1 ran toward the woods. Staff 1 heard Youth A say staff
were coming and to run. Staff 3 and Staff 4 were in the area
trying to use proximity control to keep Youth C contained to the
area. Youth A began running back towards CTC. Youth A pushed
Staff 3 at which time Staff 3 fell to the ground. Staff 3 was
continuing to use proximity control with her arms out while getting
up. Staff 3 had one of Youth A’s arms secured by holding his arm.
Staff 1 assisted Staff 3 and placed Youth A in a benevolent
restraint as Youth A was “flailing” his arms. Youth A has a pattern
of “flailing” his arms and assaulting staff by punching and kicking.
Staff 1 denied running into Youth A causing Youth A to fall to the
ground. Staff 1 denied trying to escort Youth A. Staff 1 reported
Youth A did not resist during the restraint. Staff 1 told Youth A he
would release Youth A once Youth A was safe. Staff 1 maintained
Youth A in the benevolent restraint and transitioned into a two-
person level 1 restraint with Staff 2 around Ashmun house. Youth
A was released outside Leppien house and walked up to the
house on his own. Staff 1 reported he initiated the restraint with
Youth A for a few reasons including Youth A’s history/pattern with
assaulting female staff, Youth A needs a strong male in restraints
as Youth A will “flail” his arms which turns into assaulting staff,
Youth A was pushing past staff, and Youth A has a history/pattern
of going down to CTC to break windows, pull the fire alarm, and
3

will get female youth to run. Staff 1 reported this was not the first
time Youth A has run out of bounds at the facility.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Staff 2 was told some youth had run out of bounds and
was informed the youth were down by CTC. Staff 2 and Staff 1
headed down to CTC. Staff 1 saw Youth A by the woods. Staff 2
did not recall who was with Youth A. Staff 2 thought there may
have been some female youth however was unsure. Staff 1 ran
over toward Youth A. Staff 2 reported he did not focus on Staff 1
as he was following Youth B. Staff 2 recalled other staff being
present however was unsure which staff but recalled Staff 3 being
present. Staff 2 saw Staff 1 in a benevolent restraint with Youth A
however did not see the restraint initiated. Staff 2 assisted Staff 1
in the restrained with Youth A by transitioning into a two-person
level 1 restraint. Staff 2 reported he, Staff 1, Youth A, and Staff 3
were walking back to the house with Youth A in a two-person
restraint. Staff 2 did not know where Staff 3 was prior to the
restraint. Youth A was released from the restraint prior to getting
to the Leppien parking lot and walked willingly back to Leppien
house. Staff 2 reported he was informed Youth A was restrained
for pushing staff however Staff 2 didn’t see Youth A push staff, or
the restraint being initiated. Staff 2 reported Youth A has a history
of assaulting staff.
Staff 3 was interviewed via teams meeting on 4/9/2024. Staff 3
and Staff 4 heard an assistance call for Youth A and Youth C
being out of bounds. Staff 3 and Staff 4 went to assist. Staff 3
was focused on Youth C and was using proximity control. Staff 3
reported Youth A ran away from her as she was unable to follow
Youth A due to a knee injury. Staff 3 reported she was not part of
the restraint with Youth A as Staff 1 was focused on Youth A.
Staff 3 did not see the restraint with Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 3
did not see Staff 1 run into Youth A. Staff 3 did not recall Youth A
pushing her during the incident however stated it would not be
abnormal for Youth A to push her as Youth A has pushed her
several times. Staff 3 reported she did not recall securing one of
Youth A’s arms during the incident.
Staff 4 was interviewed via teams meeting on 4/10/2024. Staff
4 reported he heard a call for additional staff over the radio for
Youth A and Youth C leaving the school and heading toward CTC.
Staff 3 and Staff 4 went to assist. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 and Staff
2 also responded. Staff 4 reported he and Staff 3 were focused
on Youth C. Staff 2 initially was trying to use proximity control with
Youth A however Youth A ran away at which time Staff 3 and Staff
4

4 were then focused on Youth C. Staff 4 did not recall if Staff 3
was pushed by Youth A at any time during the incident or if Staff 3
attempted to restrain Youth A. Staff 4 reported he thought Youth
A was placed in a benevolent restraint by Staff 1 however he did
not see the restraint initiated as he was focused on Youth C.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Administrator 1 reported she was not present for the
restraint that occurred with Youth A by Staff 1 however based on
experience with Youth A, when Youth A has an arm free, such as
in an escort, Youth A will hit staff.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Administrator 2 was not present for the restraint that
occurred with Youth A by Staff 1 however reported on the day of
the restraint, all youth but four, were running out of bounds at the
facility. Administrator 2 reported there were eleven police units on
the facilities campus addressing behaviors.
Restraint with Youth A on 3/15/2024
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/28/2024. Staff 5 was called to assist with a situation with Youth
A. Staff 5 arrived, and Youth A was in the kitchen throwing food
and a chair. Youth A was upset with a peer and wanted to go
after the peer. Staff 5 was able to verbally de-escalate Youth A
and get Youth A to leave the kitchen area and go outside to utilize
his coping skill of basketball. Staff 5 went outside with Youth A to
play basketball and Youth A took off running. Staff 5 lost sight of
Youth A then Staff 5 heard a shattering noise and saw Youth A
throwing rocks outside Leppien house. Staff 5 asked Youth A to
put the rock down which was the size of a baseball. Youth A
acted as though he was going to throw the baseball size rock at
Staff 5. Staff 5 was able to get the rock from Youth A’s hand by
guiding Youth A’s hand down. Youth A took off running again.
Youth A was headed toward 170th Ave. Staff 8 came to assist.
Staff 5 asked Staff 8 to block Youth A from throwing more rocks.
Youth A went to Holbrook to where Youth E was also out of
bounds. Youth E punched a window and was taken for medical
attention. Staff 13 began picking up glass to ensure Youth A did
not get any of the glass as Youth A has attempted to get glass
pieces in prior incidents. Youth A began going toward Staff 13
and Staff 5 stepped in between to keep Youth A from getting the
broken glass. Youth A began kicking Staff 5. Youth A walked to
another window and kicked the window. Staff 5 used proximity
control to guide Youth A away from the window by placing his arm
straight out to prevent Youth A from getting any closer to the
5

window. Staff 5 reported he was concerned if Youth A was able to
get close enough to the window that Youth A would kick the
window again and Youth A’s foot/leg would go through the window
causing Youth A to get hurt. Youth A kicked Staff 5 repeatedly in
the legs and groin area. Staff 6 came to assist and Staff 5
initiated a restraint due to safety concerns for Youth A. Staff 5
reported if he and Staff 6 would have moved from using their arms
to create distance between Youth A and the window, Youth A
would have kicked the window again and his foot/leg would have
gone through the glass. When Staff 5 initiated the benevolent
restraint, Youth A reached back and scratched the back of his
neck and kicked Staff 8 in the groin. Staff 5 transitioned Youth A
to a safety positioned and Staff 8 assisted with bridging Youth A’s
legs. Youth A then became emotional as it was muddy out and he
realized he had mud on his clothes. Youth A was slowly released
from the restrain.
Staff 6 was interviewed via teams meeting on 4/9/2024. Staff 6
responded to an assistance call and upon arriving, Youth A and a
peer, unable to recall who, were running from staff around the
building. Staff 6 went the opposite direction to try to head off
Youth A and the peer. The peer left the area, Staff 6 was with
Staff 5 and Youth A. Youth A was trying to get to the broken
window where there was glass on the ground. Staff 6 and Staff 5
were using proximity control to keep Youth A away from the
broken glass. Youth A pushed Staff 6 and Staff 5 to get to the
broken glass. Staff 6 reported she and Staff 5 placed Youth A in a
level 1 restraint due to Youth A kicking and pushing staff to get to
the glass. Staff 6 reported Youth A can kick very high, and he
appeared to be trying to kick the window with his foot. Staff 6
reported Youth A was not restrained right away as she and Staff 5
were trying to use proximity control to keep Youth A away from the
glass and while using proximity control Youth A was pushing and
kicking both her and Staff 5. Staff 6 reported the restraint was
initiated as Youth A continued to get more aggressive by shoving,
kicking, clawing at her and Staff 5, and tried to get to the broken
glass.
Staff 8 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/28/2024. Staff 8 reported he heard extra calls for support. Staff
8 arrived to assist when Staff 5 asked he keep Youth A away from
broken glass from a window. Youth A and Youth E were both
escalated, and Youth E punched a window. Staff 8 was focused
on Youth E. He returned to the house with Youth E to provide first
aid. He then returned and Youth A was still with Staff 5 and Staff
6. Youth A was in a level 1 two-person restraint with Staff 5 and
6

Staff 6. Youth A kicked Staff 6 repeatedly. Staff 8 assisted in the
restraint by bridging Youth A’s legs as Youth A was kicking Staff 5
and Staff 6 and twisting his body to get out of the restraint. Youth
A began to become emotional as he was upset, he was
restrained, and it was muddy outside. Youth A was released from
the restraint and taken to get clean clothes. Staff 8 did not see the
initiation of the restraint to know what lead to Youth A getting
restrained.
Staff 13 was interviewed via teams meeting on 4/10/2024.
Staff 13 was working with Youth A when Youth A escalated. She
called for additional assistance and Staff 5 arrived. Staff 5 arrived
and took over working with Youth A and Staff 13 went to address
another situation. Staff 13 was outside and witnessed Youth A’s
behaviors. Youth A went out of bounds. Youth A broke a window
and was trying to get the glass from the broken window. Staff 13
reported she did not recall why Staff 5 and Staff 6 initiated a
restraint. Staff 13 reported Youth A tried to get the broken glass
and threatened to harm staff. Youth A kicked another window at
which time Staff 5 and Staff 6 attempted to escort Youth A away
from the window. Youth A kicked. Staff 5 and Staff 6 transitioned
into a restraint with Youth A. Staff 13 reported Youth A twists in
restraints and Youth A is double jointed and is able to continue to
move his body in restraints to hit staff. Staff 13 recalled the
restraint transitioning to a seated safety position and Youth A’s
legs being bridged.
Restraint with Youth A on 3/18/2024
Staff 7 was interviewed via teams meeting on 4/10/2024. Staff
7 reported Youth A was escalated in school and was given
options/coping skills to use to deescalate. Youth A was refused to
use coping skills. Youth A ran out of the school and grabbed
rocks the size of a computer mouse. Youth A threw rocks at cars
and Staff 7 was used proximity control by standing in front of
Youth A. Youth A then threw rocks at Staff 7. Staff 7 reported he
was approximately one foot away from Youth A. Staff 7 placed
Youth A in a restraint. Staff 8 arrived and assisted Staff 7 and
they transitioned Youth A into a level 1 restraint. Youth A kicked
Staff 9 in the groin as Staff 9 approached to assist. Staff 7 and
Staff 8 transitioned into a seated restraint and Staff 9 bridged
Youth A’s legs due to Youth A kicking. Staff 8 talked to Youth A
while in the restraint and calmed Youth A down. Youth A was
released from the restraint. Staff 7 and Youth A returned to out of
school suspension (OSS) room at which time Youth A began
pulling the couch cover off the couch and finding nails. Youth A
was poked himself with the nails. Staff 7 removed the nails from
7

Youth A’s hand and attempted to escort Youth A out of the room.
Staff 7 reported he attempted to escort Youth A outside so the
couch could be removed from the room. Youth A punched and hit
Staff 7. Youth A swung closed fist at Staff 7 and hit him in the
collar bone. Staff 7 and Staff 8 placed Youth A in a level 1
restraint. Once Youth A was outside in the restraint, Staff 7 and
Staff 8 talked with Youth A and made a plan to release from the
restraint and return to the OSS room. Once Youth A was back in
the OSS room, he flipped tables and pulled apart the white board.
Youth A threw cards at staff. Youth A approached Staff 8 and
punched Staff 8 in the chest area. Staff 8 placed Youth A in a
benevolent restraint. Administrator 2 came to assist and helped
deescalate Youth A at which time Youth A was released from the
restraint.
Staff 8 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/28/2024. Staff 8 responded to an assistance call regarding
Youth A. When Staff 8 arrived, Staff 7 had Youth A in a
benevolent restraint. Youth A was kicking and twisting his body to
get out of the restraint. Staff 8 and Staff 7 transitioned into a two-
person restraint and Staff 9 assisted with bridging Youth A’s legs.
Youth A calmed down and agreed to go to the OSS. Youth A was
approximately halfway to the OSS room when he stopped
cooperating and shouted. Youth A got into the OSS room and
slammed the door, kicked chairs and tried to flip the table. Youth
A took his shoes off and threw his shoes at staff. Youth A
punched Staff 8 all over his body and kicked Staff 7 and Staff 13.
Youth A pulled off a part of the white board hanging on the wall.
Staff 7 and Staff 8 escorted Youth A out of the OSS room to go
outside. While escorting Youth A, Administrator 3 arrived and
Youth A kicked Administrator 3 in the stomach. Staff 7 and Staff 8
transitioned Youth A into a level 1 two-person restraint to get
outside as they were standing in the front desk office area in
Holbrook and the space was tight. Once outside the front doors of
Holbrook, Youth A was placed in a seated positioned and Staff 9
bridged Youth A’s legs. Administrator 2 arrived, and Youth A was
slowly released from the restraint. Youth A wanted to go back to
OSS. Once Youth A got back to OSS, Youth A slammed the door
and ripped apart one of the chairs. Staff 7 attempted to escort
Youth A out of OSS room however Youth A resisted. Staff 7
stopped the escort due to Youth A not willingly walking and Youth
A continued to destroy the room and throw his shoes. Youth A
tore a chair apart and was able to get staples out of the chair and
used the staples to try to claw at staff. Youth A punched Staff 7 in
the face. Staff 7 initiated a benevolent restraint that transitioned to
a seated position. Staff 8 assisted in bridging Youth A's legs while
8

Administrator 2 used verbal de-escalation and Youth A calmed
down.
Staff 9 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/28/2024. Staff 9 reported he assisted with two restraints with
Youth A on 3/18/2024. Staff 9 reported for the first restraint, he
was in the dining hall when he heard an assistance call. As Staff
9 went outside to assist, Staff 7 and Staff 8 had Youth A in a level
1 two-person restraint. Youth A kicked Staff 7 and Staff 8 at which
time Staff 9 went and assisted with bridging Youth A’s legs to
prevent Youth A from kicking staff. For the second restraint, Staff
9 heard commotion outside the front doors of Holbrook. Staff 9
went to assist and saw Youth A in a restraint with Staff 7 and Staff
8. Staff 9 talked to Youth A while he was in the restraint and
Youth A kicked at Staff 9. Staff 9 bridged Youth A’s legs. Staff 9
reported he was not present for when these two restraints were
initiated and was unsure as to what lead to the restraints.
Restraint with Youth B on 3/18/2024
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/28/2024. Youth B reported he recently left the house and was
walking toward 170th Ave due to being upset. Youth B got up in
the morning, got dressed and went to put his clothes in the
laundry room. Youth B told a peer he did not smell good at which
time another youth heard what Youth B told his peer and began
bullying the youth who had body odor. A staff, Youth B was
unable to recall who, blamed Youth B for bullying the peer. Youth
B was upset he was being blamed for bullying when he was not,
so he left the house. Youth B and Youth E both left the house
together and walked down the road. Staff, Youth B did not recall
who, came and got Youth E to return to the house. Youth B
walked in the woods as he reported he liked being in the woods,
when Administrator 1 arrived. Youth B reported there were
additional staff however he did not recall who other than
Administrator 1. Youth B reported he did not remember being
restrained by Administrator 1 or any staff. Youth B reported he did
not recall if he was by the main road or if he was mad the entire
time he was in the woods. Youth B reported he does not get
restrained often. Youth B reported he was unable to recall any of
the restraints he has been in. Youth B reported he had no
concerns with the facility.
Administrator 1 was interviewed via teams meeting on
4/9/2024. Administrator 1 arrived on campus and saw Staff 10
with two youth. Administrator 1 went to assist. While walking,
Youth B stated he was going to go fishing by the pond.
9

Administrator 1 redirected Youth B as that was not the scheduled
activity and prompted him to follow the house staff’s directions.
Administrator 1 went into the house to check on Youth E at which
time Youth E ran out of the house and encouraged Youth B to run
with him. Administrator 1 followed Youth E. Youth B followed
behind Administrator 1 and Staff 10 followed Youth B.
Administrator 1 stopped and focused on Youth B and encouraged
him to return to the house. Administrator 1 guided Youth B by
placing her hand on Youth B’s back. Youth E ran over and
punched Staff 10 and Staff 10 fell to the ground. Youth B and
Youth E ran, and Administrator 1 advised Staff 10 to return to the
house. Youth B was in the field and Youth E was on the side of
the road. Administrator 1 and Staff 11 were able to talk to Youth E
who agreed to return to the house with Staff 11. Staff 6 picked up
Administrator 1 and they drove out to US 10 and parked on the
side of the road with flashers on. Administrator 1 notified upper
administration of the situation and law enforcement was contacted
to assist due to the concern with Youth B getting closer to US 10
which is a very busy road and cars go fast. Administrator 1 and
Staff 6 walked in front of Youth B to stop him from reaching the
road. Youth B made statements that he was going to go to the
road and that he did not care if he got hit by a car. Administrator 1
reported Youth B was approximately ten yards from US 10.
Administrator 1 and Staff 6 placed Youth B in a level 4 restraint
and Youth B dropped to the ground at which time Administrator 1
and Staff 6 transitioned into a safety position. Law enforcement
arrived however Administrator 1 told law enforcement the situation
was under control. Staff 12 arrived and tried to talk to Youth B
about fishing to de-escalate and get Youth B back into his thinking
brain. Youth B kicked and pushed. Youth B got into a laying
position while in the restraint at which time the restrained was
released. Youth B got up and tried to “charge through”
Administrator 1 and Staff 6. Administrator 1 and Staff 6 initiated a
second restraint. Staff 11 and Staff 12 transitioned into the
restraint switching Administrator 1 and Staff 6 out as Administrator
1 thought Staff 11 and Staff 12 may be able to verbally de-
escalate Youth B. Youth B de-escalated and dug for worms.
Youth B walked back to the house. Administrator 1 reported the
restraint was initiated for safety as Youth B tried to get to the road
and made statements that he didn’t care if he was hit by a car.
Administrator 1 did not trust that Youth B would not run into the
road in front of a car. Youth B has a history of self-harming
behaviors. Administrator 1 reported Youth B has gone into the
road previously on different incidents.
10

Staff 10 was interviewed via teams meeting on 4/9/2024. Staff
10 reported Youth B and Youth E had gone out of bounds. Youth
B followed Youth E out of bounds. Staff 10 was down by the
therapy center with Youth B and Administrator 1. Youth B fell to
the ground and Staff 10 placed her hand on Youth B’s shoulder in
an effort to calm Youth B down at which time Youth E ran over
and told Staff 6 to get her hand off Youth B and punched Staff 10
in the chest. Staff 10 fell to the ground. Staff 10 was advised by
Administrator 1 to return to the house to get additional staff to
assist. Youth B and Youth E ran. Staff 10 reported Youth B was
not in a restraint when he fell to the ground. Staff 10 reported
Youth E came back to the house and Youth B remained out of
bounds with Administrator 1 and other staff which Staff 10 did not
recall specifically who. Staff 10 did not see Youth B restrained.
Staff 6 was interviewed via teams meeting on 4/9/2024. Staff 6
responded to assist with Youth B when he was headed toward US
10. Staff 6 and Administrator 1 drove down and parked on US 10
and walked into the woods where Youth B was with maintenance
staff, unsure who. Staff 6 and Administrator 1 tried to stop Youth
B as he was moving toward US 10 with verbal prompts and
proximity control. Youth B shoved Staff 6 and Administrator 1 out
of his way. Youth B had his fishing pole and was “flailing” the
fishing pole around. Youth B was “huffing, puffing, groining” and
demanded Staff 6 and Administrator 1 let him through. Staff 6
reported Youth B made statements about wanting to harm himself
and others and wanting to go into the road. Staff 6 and
Administrator 1 continued to use proximity control to not allow
Youth B to get any closer to US 10 however Youth B continued to
“shove” through at which time Staff 6 and Administrator 1 initiated
a reverse level 1. Youth B fell to the ground and Staff 6 and
Administrator 1 transitioned to a seated safety position restraint.
Once on the ground Staff 6 and Administrator 1 released the
restraint. Youth B got up and tried to push through Staff 6 and
Administrator 1 to go toward US 10. At this time two maintenance
staff, unsure who, took over and were trying to use proximity
control to keep Youth B away from US 10. Youth B continued
pushing past and Staff 6 believed the maintenance staff initiated a
level 1 restraint. Youth B was able to calm down and dug for
worms with the maintenance staff.
Staff 11 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/28/2024. Staff 11 reported Youth B and Youth E walked down
170th Ave. Staff 11 and Administrator 1 and two other
maintenance workers (Staff 11 was unable to recall who), went to
support the situation by using proximity control. Youth B and
11

Youth E went into the woods. Staff 11 drove halfway down 170th
Ave. and talked to Youth E. Youth E agreed to go back to the
house with Staff 11. Staff 11 drove Youth E back to the house.
Staff 11 returned to continue assisting at which time Staff 6,
Administrator 1, and Staff 12 were in the woods with Youth B.
Staff 11 parked the vehicle on US 10 with the flashers on. Staff
11 saw Youth B was in a restraint in the woods. Staff 11 did not
see the restraint initiated or know what caused Youth B to be
placed in a restraint. Youth B was “flailing” in the restraint and not
following directions. Staff 11 and Staff 12 switched Staff 6 and
Administrator 1 out of the restraint. Staff 11 reported Youth B was
approximately twenty yards from US 10. Youth B agreed to a
safety plan and was released from the restraint.
Staff 12 was interviewed via teams meeting on 4/9/2024. Staff
12 reported he performs maintenance responsibilities at the facility
however is trained in Aegis and how to respond to youth in crisis.
Staff 12 received a text message stating two youth were out of
bounds and for him to provide assistance. Staff 12 drove down to
170th Ave. and US 10 and parked his vehicle on US 10 with his
flashers on. Staff 12 saw Youth B in the woods approximately
forty yards from US 10. Staff 12 saw Youth B laying down on the
ground with Administrator 1 and another staff, unsure who, next to
him. Youth B was calm, then would “flutter” around. Staff 12
reported Youth B was not hurt in anyway. Administrator 1 was on
one side of Youth B and another staff on the other side trying to
calm him down. Staff 12 reported Youth B was already in a
restraint when he arrived. Staff 12 and Staff 11 switched
Administrator 1 and the other staff out of the restraint as
Administrator 1 and the other staff were tired. Staff 12 reported
Youth B was able to be calmed down by talking about worms and
fishing. Youth B was released from the restraint and walked back
to campus.
Documents Reviewed:

passed them however this does not fall under severely aggressive
behavior that places the youth or others at serious threat of violence
